'For three weeks, France's Socialists believed they were as big as the ox'
Subhead: The Socialists thought that Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu's weakness meant they could force his hand. But their own division meant they couldn't choose between compromise and threatening to topple him, explains Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

Title: October 2 protests in France: Demonstrators feel disheartened but refuse to give up
Subhead: The French Interior Ministry said 195,000 people took to the streets nationwide on Thursday, October 2, compared with 505,000 on September 18. Among those protesting, bitterness prevailed over resignation.

Title: Hollywood fires back at Tilly Norwood, the actress created by AI
Subhead: The creation of digital artists could quickly lead to a creative revolution and poses a threat to actors. In 2023, actors went on a lengthy strike, which resulted in artificial intelligence (AI) being barred from using their work without their consent.

Title: House of African Worlds opens its doors in Paris
Subhead: The institution, initiated by the Elysée Palace in 2021, opens on October 4 in Paris' 10th arrondissement, while awaiting a more permanent location.

Title: Trump's 20-point plan for Gaza, explained and analyzed
Subhead: While lacking a precise timeframe, the Gaza peace plan released by the White House, and accepted by Israel under some conditions, leaves several crucial points open to interpretation.

Title: Svalbard, the fastest-warming place on Earth
Subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (1/6). The Norwegian archipelago has warmed by 4°C over the past 30 years. Landslides and thawing permafrost threaten the population, whose way of life is highly greenhouse gas-intensive.
